title: The TVLine-Up: What’s Returning, New and Leaving the Week of Jan. 26
description: This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025. With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or […]
author: Ryan Schwartz
excerpt: 'The Recruit' and 'School Spirits' are back after long hiatuses. Also new this week: 'Matlock,' 'NCIS' and a #OneChicago crossover — see schedule.
text: This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025. With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. So consider this our reminder to set your DVR, order a Season Pass, pop a fresh Memorex into the VCR… however it is you roll. This week, you’ll find more than 20 returning shows (including All American, Mythic Quest, The Recruit, School Spirits and pretty much everything on CBS), eight newcomers (including Sterling K. Brown’s Paradise and Morris Chestnut’s Watson) and so much more. html:
This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025.

With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. So consider this our reminder to set your DVR, order a Season Pass, pop a fresh Memorex into the VCR… however it is you roll.

This week, you’ll find more than 20 returning shows (including All American, Mythic Quest, The Recruit, School Spirits and pretty much everything on CBS), eight newcomers (including Sterling K. Brown’s Paradise and Morris Chestnut’s Watson) and so much more.

SUNDAY, JAN. 26
3 pm NFC Championship Game (Fox)
6:30 pm AFC Championship Game (CBS)
10 pm Vienna Blood Season 4 finale (PBS)
10 pm Watson series premiere (CBS, immediately following AFC Championship Game)

MONDAY, JAN. 27
3 am Tribunal Justice Season 2 premiere (Prime Video)
8 pm The Bachelor Season 29 premiere (ABC)
8 pm The Neighborhood returns (CBS)
8 pm Saturday Night Live: Ladies and Gentleman… 50 Years of SNL Music special (NBC)
8:30 pm Poppa’s House returns (CBS)
9 pm The Fall of Diddy docuseries premiere (Investigation Discovery)
9 pm NCIS returns (CBS)
10 pm NCIS: Origins returns (CBS)

TUESDAY, JAN. 28
3 am Paradise series premiere (Hulu; first three episodes)
3 am Tom Green: I Got a Mule! comedy special (Prime Video)
8 pm FBI returns (CBS)
9 pm The Fall of Diddy docuseries finale (Investigation Discovery)
9 pm FBI: International returns (CBS)
9 pm The Real Housewives of New York City Reunion, Part 1 of 2 (Bravo)
10 pm FBI: Most Wanted returns (CBS)

WEDNESDAY, JAN. 29
3 am American Manhunt: O.J. Simpson docuseries premiere (Netflix; all four episodes)
3 am Mythic Quest Season 4 premiere (Apple TV+; first two episodes)
3 am Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man series premiere (Disney+; first two episodes)
8 pm All American Season 7 premiere (The CW; special night)
8 pm The Challenge: All Stars Season 5 premiere (MTV)
8 pm Hollywood Squares time period premiere (CBS)
8 pm #OneChicago crossover (NBC; three-hour event)
8 pm The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City Reunion, Part 2 of 3 (Bravo)
9 pm The Price Is Right at Night time period premiere (CBS)
10 pm Raid the Cage time period premiere (CBS)

THURSDAY, JAN. 30
3 am Mo final season premiere (Netflix; all eight episodes)
3 am The Recruit Season 2 premiere (Netflix; all eight episodes)
3 am School Spirits Season 2 premiere (Paramount+; first three episodes)
3 am You’re Cordially Invited movie premiere (Prime Video)
7 pm 2025 Pro Bowl Games: Skills Showdown (ESPN)
8 pm Georgie & Mandy’s First Marriage returns (CBS)
8:30 pm Ghosts returns (CBS)
9 pm Bookie Season 2 finale (Max)
9 pm Matlock returns (CBS)
9 pm Scamanda docuseries premiere (ABC)
10 pm Elsbeth returns (CBS)

FRIDAY, JAN. 31
3 am Goodrich streaming premiere (Max)
3 am Tom Green Country docuseries premiere (Prime Video)
3 am Vietnam: The War That Changed America docuseries premiere (Apple TV+; all six episodes)
9 pm Fire Country returns (CBS)
10 pm S.W.A.T. returns/time period premiere (CBS)
1:30 am They Call It Late Night With Jason Kelce Season 1 finale (ESPN)

Want scoop on any of the above shows? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line.

January Streaming Guide: 80+ Premieres!
